intro: Wurmbea latifolia subsp. vanessae, commonly known as the Vanessae Wurmbea, is a member of the Asparagaceae family and is native to southern Africa. It is a perennial herb characterized by its broad, strap-like leaves and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or rocky crevices. Its bulbs are often used in traditional medicine for their purported healing properties. The subspecies is distinguished by its slightly different leaf morphology and flowering habits compared to the main species.
